intro: Oldenlandia krewanhensis, commonly known as the Krewana or Krewanh grass, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, tropical environments. Its small white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it has slender, grass-like leaves. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
